subject: Entrepreneurship
title: YouTube's Unexpected Journey
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on YouTube's Unexpected Journey.

hook.text: YouTube launched in 2005 as a video dating site called 'Tune In Hook Up.' Nobody used it for dating.

buildup.text: The founders waited for dating profiles. Instead, people uploaded random funny clips and music videos.

discovery.text: Rather than force the dating concept, they listened to users and pivoted to general video sharing.

twist.text: A clip of Janet Jackson's Super Bowl incident showed them the real demand: viral, shareable moments.

climax.text: Within a year, YouTube served 100 million video views per day. Google bought it for $1.65 billion.

punchline.text: Users told YouTube what it should be. The founders listened.

quiz.question: What was YouTube's original concept before it pivoted?
options: A platform for professional video creators and filmmakers
A video dating site where people posted personal profiles
A live-streaming service for sports events
